newsitem.title: UK: T&N buys landmark asbestos insurance policy.
newsitem.headline: T&N buys landmark asbestos insurance policy.

text.p: British-based automotive components group T&N Plc said on Wednesday that it had agreed a complex insurance deal to limit its potential liabilities from asbestos-related disease claims in the future.

The reinsurance deal, which had been rumoured for several months, will cost T&N a one-off premium of 92 million pounds, but it will also set aside 373 million pounds ($623 million) of provisions this year for its share of possible liabilities.

"The directors believe the plan will significantly reduce the uncertainty for shareholders, enabling the fundamental worth of the group's businesses to be better reflected in the market value of T&N," the company said in a statement.

The 373 million pound provision is made up of two elements -- 323 million agreed after a detailed insurance study of the present value of possible future claims and an extra 50 million pounds to cover certain past claims which would proceed if the disputed Georgine settlement system in the U.S were to fail.
If the defined future claims exceed a present value of 380 million pounds, the insurance policy will take effect and provide 500 million pounds of cover, the company said.
The insurance is being provided by a consortium of reinsurers including Centre Reinsurance, part of Zurich Group, Munich Reinsurance Co, and Swiss Re unit European International Reinsurance Co.
